newsitem.title: USA: Trans World Airlines launches New York ads.
newsitem.headline: Trans World Airlines launches New York ads.

text.p: Trans World Airlines Inc said on Tuesday it is launching a print, radio and television advertising campaign in the New York market.

"TWA has refocused its operation in the New York area to improve customer service and to concentrate on those destinations New Yorkers want most," said Lisabeth Mack, TWA staff vice president-advertising and consumer marketing, in a statement.

TWA has consolidated most of its operations in New York into John F. Kennedy International airport's terminal five. The carrier is also switching to Boeing 767 planes and new Boeing 757s on most of its trans-Atlantic and transcontinental routes.
The advertising campaign, created by D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles, is expected to run eight weeks in two, four-week segments and is valued at about $1.3 million.
